column4: does edubuntu use the same repos as ubuntu/kubuntu/xubuntu use?
yes
so edubuntu is just another virtual package?
virtual is not exactly the right word - much work was done making it work with thin client and optimized software choices
virtual package, isn't that the exact dpkg term?
I didn't think so - edubuntu is a set of packages like ubuntu or kubuntu.  maybe your right but it does not sound right to me.  It is not just a meta-package
not just but it is available as such and it's installation is managed that way. It is a full distro like kubuntu, ... but it resides in the *buntu package repos.
ok - you win :)
was there something to win? what is the reward? :)
actually, edubuntu (one word) is not a meta package.  edubuntu usually refers to the distribution variant, not a package.
I am just wondering if it makes any sense to download the edubuntu installer cds if I already have the ubuntu ones.
so, you win!
that is a good question.  I doubt it BUT if you are really going to do classroom installs, the cd is probably a good idea, to assure the cleanliness of the excersize
I am just interested in the ltsp stuff and wondering, if they manage the installation more convenient with their installer cd.
dunno - i bet they do because of the intended audience.  why don't you try it and then tell me?
I might. Will try to find out in #edubuntu first.
bon voyage :)
merci beaucoup.
de nada
I'll tell you what I found out next time I'll see you. "De nada" is not very french however.
de rien would fit better
do let me know - i am curious but lazy :)  and it wasn't meant to be french :)
tak
